blocks.content: Define the well-founded relation predicate. Definition 6.24(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 30. For alternate definitions, see ~ dffr2 and ~ dffr3 . (Contributed by NM, 3-Apr-1994.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-fr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wfr(c0, c1), wal(s0, wi(wa(wss(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)), wrex(s1, cv(s0), wral(s2, cv(s0), wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
}

blocks.name: df-se
blocks.content: Define the set-like predicate. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-se(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wse(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wcel(crab(s1, c1, wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))), universe)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
}

blocks.name: fri
blocks.content: Property of well-founded relation (one direction of definition). (Contributed by NM, 18-Mar-1997.)
blocks.origin:
thm fri(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wfr(c2, c3)), wa(wss(c0, c3), wne(c0, emptycls))), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  imp31(wcel(c0, c1), wfr(c2, c3), wa(wss(c0, c3), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0))))))
  syl5bi(wcel(c0, c1), wfr(c2, c3), wi(wa(wss(c0, c3), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))))), wal(hs0, wi(wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls)), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(hs0), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0))))))))
  df-fr(hs0, s0, s1, c2, c3)
  spcgv(hs0, c0, c1, wi(wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls)), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(hs0), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))))), wi(wa(wss(c0, c3), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls)), wrex(s0, cv(hs0), wral(s1, cv(hs0), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0))))), wa(wss(c0, c3), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0))))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wss(c0, c3), wne(c0, emptycls))
  sseq1(cv(hs0), c0, c3)
  neeq1(cv(hs0), c0, emptycls)
  rexeqbi1dv(s0, cv(hs0), c0, wral(s1, cv(hs0), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))))
  raleq(s1, cv(hs0), c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0))))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wa(wss(c0, c3), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)))))))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

  raleq(s1, hs0, c0, Â¬ s1[c2]s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)

  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

blocks.name: seex
blocks.content: The ` R ` -preimage of an element of the base set in a set-like relation is a set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm seex(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wse(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wcel(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, c2)), universe))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  sylanb(wse(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1), wcel(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, c2)), universe), wral(hs0, c1, wcel(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(hs0))), universe)))
  df-se(hs0, s0, c0, c1)
  rspccva(hs0, c1, c2, wcel(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(hs0))), universe), wcel(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, c2)), universe))
  eleq1d(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(hs0))), universe, crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, c2)), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  rabbidv(s0, c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, c2))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c2, cv(s0), c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(crab(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, c2)), universe))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

  rabbidv(s0, c1, hs0 = c2, s0[c0]hs0, s0[c0]c2)
  breq2(hs0, c2, s0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w({ s0 âˆˆ c1 | s0[c0]c2 } âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)

  df-se(hs1, hs0, c2, c0)

  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: dffr2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of well-founded relation. Similar to Definition 6.21 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 30. (Contributed by NM, 17-Feb-2004.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 27-Aug-2011.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 23-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dffr2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wfr(c0, c1), wal(s0, wi(wa(wss(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)), wrex(s1, cv(s0), wceq(crab(s2, cv(s0), wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))), emptycls)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {
  bitr4i(wfr(c0, c1), wal(s0, wi(wa(wss(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)), wrex(s1, cv(s0), wceq(crab(s2, cv(s0), wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))), emptycls)))), wal(s0, wi(wa(wss(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)), wrex(s1, cv(s0), wral(s2, cv(s0), wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))))))))
  df-fr(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  albii(s0, wi(wa(wss(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)), wrex(s1, cv(s0), wceq(crab(s2, cv(s0), wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))), emptycls))), wi(wa(wss(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)), wrex(s1, cv(s0), wral(s2, cv(s0), wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1)))))))
  imbi2i(wa(wss(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)), wrex(s1, cv(s0), wceq(crab(s2, cv(s0), wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))), emptycls)), wrex(s1, cv(s0), wral(s2, cv(s0), wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))))))
  rexbii(s1, cv(s0), wceq(crab(s2, cv(s0), wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))), emptycls), wral(s2, cv(s0), wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1)))))
  rabeq0(s2, cv(s0), wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1)))
}

blocks.name: frc
blocks.content: Property of well-founded relation (one direction of definition using class variables). (Contributed by NM, 17-Feb-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm frc(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wfr(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1), wne(c2, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(crab(s1, c2, wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))), emptycls)))
  -| wcel(c2, universe)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  sylibr(w3a(wfr(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1), wne(c2, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(crab(s1, c2, wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))), emptycls)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  3impb(wfr(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1), wne(c2, emptycls), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  mpanl1(wfr(c0, c1), wa(wss(c2, c1), wne(c2, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wcel(c2, universe))
  fri(s0, s1, c2, universe, c0, c1)
  rexbii(s0, c2, wceq(crab(s1, c2, wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))), emptycls), wral(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))
  rabeq0(s1, c2, wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))
}

blocks.name: efrirr
blocks.content: Irreflexivity of the epsilon relation: a class founded by epsilon is not a member of itself. (Contributed by NM, 18-Apr-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: efrn2lp
blocks.content: A set founded by epsilon contains no 2-cycle loops. (Contributed by NM, 19-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: epse
blocks.content: The epsilon relation is set-like on any class. (This is the origin of the term "set-like": a set-like relation "acts like" the epsilon relation of sets and their elements.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: weeq1

blocks.name: weeq2
blocks.content: Equality theorem for the well-ordering predicate. (Contributed by NM, 3-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: wefr
blocks.content: A well-ordering is well-founded. (Contributed by NM, 22-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: weso
blocks.content: A well-ordering is a strict ordering. (Contributed by NM, 16-Mar-1997.)

blocks.name: wetrep

blocks.name: we0
blocks.content: Any relation is a well-ordering of the empty set. (Contributed by NM, 16-Mar-1997.)

blocks.name: wereu
blocks.content: A subset of a well-ordered set has a unique minimal element. (Contributed by NM, 18-Mar-1997.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)
